definition: to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless
to weave/to plait/to organize/to group/to arrange/to edit/to compile/to write/to compose/to fabricate

sentences.english: The shooting script was actually based on two scripts (written separately by Welles and Mankiewicz) that Welles combined into one for the final version.
sentences.chinese: 威尔斯最终用的是他和曼凯维支写的剧本的混编版。

sentences.english: The coach mixed the three classes for this exercise.
sentences.chinese: 这次训练，教练把三个班混编在一起了。

sentences.english: Your best bet would be to go with Titians mixed with some Infantry, and working your way up to Hammerheads.
sentences.chinese: 你最好的方法是用泰坦混编一些步兵，进而出锤头。

sentences.english: The armed forces deliberately integrated their units .
sentences.chinese: 武装部队有意地混编了他们的队伍。

definition: to include (in a list etc)/to assign (to a class, a work unit etc)
wing (of an air force)/sports team representing a combination of entities (e.g. United Korea)
to expand (esp. by new recruitment)/to increase the army/to augment
formation (of a sports team, troops etc)
